travelPlans.title: Lonavala
travelPlans.method: Conventionally the beauty of Lonavala is hard to be described in words. Be it dense flora and fauna, variety of entertainment spots or hot piping delicacies; it lures the attention of many tourists worldwide. It just 110 km away from Mumbai, Lonavala is one of the fascinating hills Station. This spot looks more alive and charming during monsoons. Mostly commoners believe that meaning of name “Lonavala” is resting pieces of stones. There are various secret home-guarded delicacies and the place is famous for many things. The most renowned and affectionately loved is the sweet slab known as “Chikki”. The bites are crunchy, sweet and various organic flavors are a replenishing treat to our taste buds.

travelPlans.title: Akshardham Mandir Delhi
travelPlans.method: Akshardham Temple is a famous Hindu temple and a spiritual-cultural complex. Also known as Swaminarayan Akshardham, it is dedicated to Lord Swaminarayan. Akshardham has made its way to the Guinness Book of World Records as the World's Largest Comprehensive Hindu Temple.

travelPlans.title: Hawa Mahal(Jaipur)
travelPlans.method: Hawa Mahal was built in Rajputana architectural style. The palace is constructed of beautiful red and pink sandstone and it looks like a five storeyed Pyramid. The palace stands on a podium which is fifty feet high from base. Its unique five-storey exterior has 953 small windows called jharokhas decorated with intricate latticework. The original intention of the lattice was to allow royal ladies to observe everyday life in the street below without being seen. Through these windows, cool air enters in the palace and makes the inner environment cool and pleasant.

travelPlans.title: Burj Khalifa
travelPlans.method: Burj Khalifa already holds the title of the world's tallest structure, and now it can add another accolade to its list, after being named among the world's most beautiful buildings.

travelPlans.title: Tithal beach
travelPlans.method: great beach its located 5 km around valsad city cool huge beach great place and its love to be feel sunset here

travelPlans.title: Ujjain mahakal
travelPlans.method: Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga is a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva and is one of the twelve Jyotirlingams, shrines which are said to be the most sacred abodes of Shiva. It is located in the ancient city of Ujjain in the state of Madhya Pradesh, India. The temple is situated on the side of the holy river Shipra.
